intro: Sidalcea calycosa subsp. calycosa, commonly known as the showy milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has compound leaves with small, oval leaflets and produces small, bean-like pods that contain several seeds. This subspecies is often found in California and adjacent states, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
